title: Fuel Pump and Filter Assembly - Installation

body.body: Fuel Pump and Filter Assembly - Installation
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Install a new sealing ring in the fuel pump assembly, with the seal lip facing uppermost, and make sure that it is correctly seated.
Taking care to make sure that the sealing ring is not damaged or dislodged, manoeuvre the fuel pump assembly into the fuel tank aperture.
Reconnect the fuel level sensor electrical connector and hook the wiring behind the hook on the fuel pump body.

body.name: Fuel Pump and Filter Assembly Installation (cegz_1.svg)

body.body: Routing the fuel level sender wiring over the fuel level sender arm will prevent the sender arm from moving through its full range of movement, causing incorrect fuel gauge readings.
Locate the fuel pump and filter assembly to the fuel tank.
Make sure that the locating peg on the fuel pump assembly is located in the cut out on the mounting plate and the offset hole is positioned as shown below.
In the sequence shown below, tighten the mounting plate fixings to
Fuel Pump Mounting Plate Torque Sequence
Refill the fuel tank with the fuel drained earlier.
Reconnect the battery, positive (red) lead first and tighten the battery terminals to
Start the engine and check carefully for fuel leaks. Rectify as necessary.

search: Fuel Pump and Filter Assembly - Installation
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Fixings
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Tightening Procedures
Install a new sealing ring in the fuel pump assembly, with the seal lip facing uppermost, and make sure that it is correctly seated.
Sealing ring
Seal lip
Taking care to make sure that the sealing ring is not damaged or dislodged, manoeuvre the fuel pump assembly into the fuel tank aperture.
Reconnect the fuel level sensor electrical connector and hook the wiring behind the hook on the fuel pump body.
Fuel level sender connector
Hook
Routing the fuel level sender wiring over the fuel level sender arm will prevent the sender arm from moving through its full range of movement, causing incorrect fuel gauge readings.
Locate the fuel pump and filter assembly to the fuel tank.
Make sure that the locating peg on the fuel pump assembly is located in the cut out on the mounting plate and the offset hole is positioned as shown below.
Offset hole position
Locating peg
In the sequence shown below, tighten the mounting plate fixings to
5 Nm
Fuel Pump Mounting Plate Torque Sequence
Refit the fuel tank (see
Fuel Tank - Installation
Refill the fuel tank with the fuel drained earlier.
Reconnect the battery, positive (red) lead first and tighten the battery terminals to
4.5 Nm
Start the engine and check carefully for fuel leaks. Rectify as necessary.
Refit the rider's seat (see
Rider's Seat - Removal/Installation
